meanings.definition: The amount of food that can be lifted with a fork.
meanings.sent1: She took a forkful of pasta and savored the delicious taste.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed every forkful of the cake at the party.
meanings.sent3: The forkful of salad did a little dance on her plate.
meanings.sent4: Each forkful of soup was a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The forkful of ice cream melted in his mouth, leaving a sweet sensation.

meanings.definition: A single bite of food picked up with a fork.
meanings.sent1: With each forkful, she tasted the flavors of the dish.
meanings.sent2: He carefully placed the forkful of steak in his mouth.
meanings.sent3: The forkful of broccoli tried to escape from her plate.
meanings.sent4: The forkful of pie was a taste of heaven in every bite.
meanings.sent5: As she ate the forkful of cake, a smile spread across her face.
